p: Human respiratory pathogens have been recognized to be associated with the initiation or aggravation of neurological diseases, but the etiology is still poorly understood [ 74]. A persistent HCoV- 229E infection was observed in the brains from different age groups after autopsy and may play a role in further chronic pathologies witnessed with coronoviral infections [ 75, 76]. HCoV-OC43 was shown to establish a persistent infection in human cells [ 77, 78], and was detected in the CNS of mice a year after an infection that triggered acute encephalitis [ 58].
